We are having a bit of a time tonight one way or another what with the new people moving in down the road causing upset all round as they have dogs which they let them bark all hours and get on every bodies nerves and Uncle Jules wanting to put Larma in for 1 down, so me and my mother Freedom have been trying to keep out of it making a new hat for the Meeting in Edinbourouhg as she says her old one woânt do, and I trying to finish off a poem for Easter Morning allthough time is running out, but we have now got a good size van to take the harmonium so that means the cousins will be able to come as well which is Good News for Lady Scott as they will be able to help her up with it. I have also been finding out abut Sir Water and wondering if he is related

Don't, don't you want me?
You know I can't believe it when I hear that you won't see me
Don't, don't you want me?

Beast of Burden, self-inflicted harm (reveal), stinks (hoping for some obscure Empire word for skunk or Camembert), horses (puhleeze), 13A where half the clue would have done, and that darned equestrian things that rears it's whinnying head once in a while but apparently isn't remembered by me. Oh, well. Rough.

This is a grid shape I really like, the middle ones help with the rest so I didn't do too badly.

I also found your words yesterday, and today, very moving.
Didn't quite like to reply then, but hope this response won't be out of place. The Spring-Autumn aspect of that brought me in mind of Dick Gaughan's version of Both Sides the Tweed, with its lyric that can maybe link us from Burns through past these Brexitatious times in a love-conquers-all sort of way...
Let the love of our land's sacred rights
To the love of our people succeed
Let friendship and honour unite
And flourish on both sides the Tweed. No sweetness the senses can cheer
Which corruption and bribery bind
No brightness that gloom can e'er clear
For honour's the sum of the mind

Annoyed at giving up so easily and revealing 25a! which although thankfully not a common form now, has some famous examples in the history of the UK and France; and the Red Queen.
Have been a little down the last few months, so have not felt up to joining in with the happy splother of the cafe but I have to feel I am getting better, I don't like taking drugs so rather than go to the doctor for 'something' I tend to reach into my etui for suitable maxims 'fake it till you make it' & "when you're going through Hell, keep going' - amazingly these sometimes work :)
Not happy with 2D. To govern is to serve unless we're in some tinpot dictatorship. Oh... wait.
Goodness my mind needs a slap today! For a moment I was unsure whether it was a spoiler for 13 or 24.

Would have been quite quick if I had not been interrupted by my lovely neighbours checking up on me. Had to ask them to collect antibiotics for me yesterday, for a chest infection. Still I get to spend lots of time in the garden in the sunshine, with the odd visitor, and get a day out next week to the local hospital for a chest X-ray.
EPT spoiler for the dance.
An enjoyable challenge.

I called Mammie McG this morning to reminisce, but she was too upset after being scared half to death last night by her potential boyfriend David Attenborough. Having watched it myself, it was a very disturbing hour of telly.
We talked about what we can do of a practical nature. Eat less red meat, do not waste food, recycle more, fit solar panels and insulate our houses, fly less, buy a hybrid or electric car, encourage smaller families, plant more trees, etc, etc. I wonder if we truly have the collective will to change, though.
14d came in handy for the lyricist of Let's Get away from it All when Alaska and Hawaii were made US states and so a rhyme was needed for L in place of the rhyme for XLVIII.

Perhaps I should have been on the boat at Oxford Circus but needs must. I was visiting elderly stepmum and had cause to wend my way to Victoria via the tube station. A load of guys got on wearing white suits and sporting white wigs, white facial hair and holding black canes. I thought they might be Einsteins returning from a spot of climate change protesting. Found out it was a stag party :)
I 8a say later on they’ll be 12d somewhere after a few too many.

Hi Chrissy,
I'm also sorry to hear you've been struggling. It is really hard to reach out when you feel low. I struggle similarly and tend to withdraw.
How about we both keep trying?
(Part of me wanted to wimp out and tag this comment onto an older post so you would find it in 'secret' but finally decided that honesty about mental health might help someone else).
Take care x

I am not sure we have the collective will to do the big things. I feel sometimes that the change required is too great. It doesn't stop me doing my wee bit but I dont see a political or popular movement towards effective action.
Hmm, 6D is Spanish!

There are simple things to do as a start, I always tell people with idling cars to turn their engines off. Yesterday I asked three people to turn off their car engines. They were all outside their cars! Two did & I thanked them but one lady asked me what it had to do with me and left the engine running, tailgate open probably channeling fumes inside. She told me to bugger off because she had two small children to tend to. God help us.

Brave and honest to talk about suffering from mental health problems. Been there with depression a couple of times and learned only recently on the radio that 45% of women on HRT suffer from depression looking back a light bulb moment for me. I too am sure it helps not only oneself but others to share. When I was a physio aeons ago in a sanatorium where some of the patients with chronic chest conditions were also depressed they were pleased to talk to me because I understood and didn’t tell them to snap out of it. So keep sharing.
Might have been more use!

There are a few words in this CW that match up nicely with Easter. Except for 6 and 25 this was very doable for me and I enjoyed it. For EPT I picked the song Shout to the Lord as somewhat of an Easter theme. It was performed by American Idol contestants in 2008
( I think ). Even if one is not religious, you may enjoy this. Many/most have probably already heard it. The video is blurry...sorry. I don't know why. Excuse and maybe indulge me a bit in my choice. I find the song inspirational. My partner used to be a professional singer and guitar player many years ago. He limits his playing now for Sunday church. He does this song better than anyone I have ever heard sing it...of course I'm bias. Lucky me to get a private concert each Sunday morning when he practices for the songs he will be playing and singing in church. Wish I had a link for him singing it, but that is not to be. Hope nobody is offended and some may be inspired, if not by the words, maybe just by how beautiful the music is.
My mom died 10 years ago today, so I am enjoying thinking about her a bit today. I am not a person to do anniversaries of when people die, and often the date passes without me remembering. Maybe a protective mechanism, but this year I am allowing myself to think of her and how lucky I was to have such a remarkable person in my life.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cq9OIhd3bSU

I did mean that, yes, but then after posting wondered about the very point you make. However, dear old Bill Clinton didn't inhale did he (the idiot), presumably because the smoke didn't go into his lungs? Supposedly.

I am tempted to say that the most popular recreational drug used nowadays is Derision. In society as a whole, and even on this normally 14 forum, the antisocial 13d of Derision is an all too common occurrence.
To counteract all the overarching climate and political terrors; I decided to spend the better part of the day in the garden. Such a beautiful, warm, quiet, spring Friday. I weeded the flower beds, cut the grassy bit, and had a good old time carefully cleaning out the pond. This year we have lots of frog tadpoles, and even some newts have come to breed; and the dragonfly larvae are there in great abundance. They are pretty scary. A dog-sized one of those would be terrifying. Our resident robin, who we call Gibb, always comes down and waits for worms then I am weeding and digging. He has lost part of his tail this year, probably in a scrap. He is a territorial little bugger, and I can’t help feeling that he would have voted leave given half a chance; but we like him nonetheless. It was lovely.
The Nipper’s Easter Bonnet parade at nursery went off without a hitch. He looked bemused, but resigned, in the photos. His ma then told me that he deconstructed the hat she had so lovingly created, and gave small bits of decoration to his mates, and the nursery staff; he then bequeathed the bonnet itself to another boy who had taken a shine to it.
I hope you all have a happy Easter; and to susanhenna, I hope the first 5d day of Passover is going swimmingly, and that the big Seder meal is an epiphany-worthy triumph.

To many it's the Easter w/e an enforced bank holiday or 2 like Xmas where you have to fork out money for gifts and collide with hugely overloaded trollies in the supermarket. Oh and then there's the sitting around eating and drinking too much! Least it's sunny!
Who was getting married, mrsm, Colonel Sanders?

sometimes it corrects me when i was right in the first place. No cheats or checks la la la.
Glass of wine for me

Monkey Jammas
I'm starting a new thread. Was interested to hear you have a PHD. Would be very informative to hear about it and what it involved. I know your knowledge is way beyond mine in these areas and it's good to learn.

What a kind wee boy your Nipper is.

Good one today, though revealed two.
Oldie but goodie re- 4D, Taxi driver. (NB could have equally been a lady 4D - but it was late at night!)
Scene: late, rainy night and a man takes shelter in a doorway.He finally manages to hail a taxi. He notices that the 4D has a lugubrious, pained expression and a voice tinged with despondency ...
4D: Ahh, perfect timing - you're just like Mick Smith'.
Passenger:' Who ?
4D: 'Mick Smith. He always did everything right all the time - like my arrival just when you needed a taxi. It happened to Mick every single time' !
Passenger: ' Oh, come on now, there's always a few clouds over everybody'!
4D: 'Nah! See, that's where you're wrong. He could have won Wimbledon, could have played golf with pros - had a voice like Caruso, danced like Fred Astaire, played the piano like - Ahh...'
Passenger: 'Well, he certainly sounds like quite an extraordinary guy!'
4D: 'You bet! But there's more! He had a memory like a computer: never forgot a birthday. He knew everything about wine, what to choose on the menu and which knives and forks to eat with. Additionally , he could fix anything - I change a fuse and the entire street blacks out.'
Passenger: 'Wow! Quite a guy, then!'
4D: ' And he knew how to treat a woman and make her feel like a princess - he'd never answer back even when she was in the wrong. And his clothes were always immaculate and his shoes highly polished too'.
Passenger: ' Sounds an absolutely amazing fellow! How did you meet him?'
4D: ( after a pause ) 'Well, I never actually met him.'
Passenger: 'Then how come you know so much about him?'
4D: ( Long hesitation... )
'I married his widow.'
I recognise that scenario very well mrsm . I'm sure I still have the badge somewhere which is not to say I wouldn't wear it now but like you, I'll listen better before I do
You are right, London. It was maybe bad timing on my part.

Kath , I do not have a Phd although, technically, I am in the middle of studying for one. My background is as an Engineering degree student in the power industry at about the time of the coal strike. Latterly I took to studying Sustainable Energy Technology (Masters) followed by a degree (module) in Oceanography which naturally led me on to Earth Sciences.
My recent diversion (?) is to understand as much as I can about climate-change processes (current and historical) and Darwinian evolution theory.

column8:
Nothing wrong with standing up for workers in the retail and hospitality sectors - amongst our lowest paid.
Over the years these businesses have pushed for greater opening hours, driven by the general community who like the convenience of longer operating hours. Fine. But it should not be at the expense of a fair wage. If the community wants this convenience then the community needs to pay for it.

column1: How Shorten the Redeemer met Morrison the Disruptor – and decided to fight back | Katharine Murphy | Australia news
column8:
I am of the belief that Shorten has been taking the high road when it comes to maintaining a conversation with Australian voters... something which the past three Coalition prime ministers in the past six years have failed miserably to do. The Coalition in fact appear incapable of taking the moral or ethical high road on any issue from border control to climate change unless forced to do so because of circumstances beyond their control.
Shorten has been accused of being a union thug, a sycophant who puts his shoes under billionaires' tables ...and much else.. yet he has maintained his dignity and has lead a cohesive and sold Labor team for six years, while his Coalition opponents have resorted to gutter tactics, lies and smear, while not only losing one prime minister after another, but their most senior front bench Ministers who decided they'd had enough and were getting out while they could still retire on a higher pension than if they remained ...in Opposition.

column1: How Shorten the Redeemer met Morrison the Disruptor – and decided to fight back | Katharine Murphy | Australia news
column8: In my opinion most of the young journalist do not have the necessary intellect and skills when interviewing this current Prime Minister Scott Morrison, some of the older more experienced Journalist seem to be afraid to take Morrison on to expose the man for who he really is? Who is he? For instance we do know he is an extremely devoted practising Evangelical Pentecostal Christian where the principles of the Prosperity Gospel is at the top of his list of values, hence his constant phrase “ for those who have a go, will get a go”. he fails to acknowledge that for many thousands of Australians who are having a go, is off the back of funding by the taxpayer, for instance many of the Not for Profit Institutions, including the hundreds of evangelical worship centres that keep popping up all around Australia, it is the fasting growing Christian Movement in Australia and America. We know very little about his previous employment history before he became the member for Cook and entered the Parliament. We do know albeit it very sketchy details of his employment with the New Zealand Government as CEO of New Zealand Tourism and Sport where Scott Morrison had his contract terminated about midway into his term by the NZ Government, some of the issues was about inappropriate spend of hundreds of thousands of dollars, not following due process. The Australian Public have a right to know why was he sacked. The next posting Morrison under took was in Australia as CEO of Tourism Australia, again his contract was terminated mid term by the Howard Government. Morrison walked with a huge taxpayer funded payout of hundreds of thousands of dollars. Is Morrison incompetent? or is he using of form of strategy to get fired as a means of creating wealth without actually having to work for it. Remember his big game is the values of The Prosperity Gospel. The Australian Public have a pretty good insight into Bill Shorten work ethics, the moment the Liberals won Government in 2013 they commissioned a Royal Commission into the Union Movement in the hope they could end Bill Shortens political career, that tactic failed. Show Pony SCMO personal integrity needs to have a light shone on it as to his suitability to be the Prime Minister of Australia.

Some RWNJ are whining about penalty rates are putting people out of business.
This didn't happen when penalty rates were first introduced in Australia in 1947.
In fact the post war years were historically the biggest in Australian GDP growth, which means, GDP being the amount spent on shit, because of penalty rates and other union won worker entitlements, workers had more money to spend on shit increasing economic activity.
This was also the start of the "fair go" mentality Morrison has warped into something entirely different.
